did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. Glen Dell papers 1969-1989
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Established in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. Glen Dell served 1984-1986 as an executive in finance and administration with JWT Group. Collection spans the years 1969-1989 and includes financial reports, correspondence, acquisition and investment information, as well as materials on JWT's subsidiaries and international operations (including Canada, China, Europe and South Africa). Companies referenced in the papers include Carl Byoir, Gray and Company, Hill & Knowlton, Lord Geller Federico & Einstein, and Ogilvy & Mather. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48-hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. Glen Dell Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company Glen Dell Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 1993.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession 93-010 is described in this collection guide.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection spans the years 1969-1989 and includes financial reports, correspondence, acquisition and investment information, as well as materials on JWT's subsidiaries and international operations (including Canada, China, Europe and South Africa). Companies referenced in the papers include Carl Byoir, Gray and Company, Hill & Knowlton, Lord Geller Federico & Einstein, and Ogilvy & Mather.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into two series: General Files and International Operations.
